title: The Evening: Moscow Pessimistic, U.S. Econ Surge, Funk 49, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Moscow Pessimistic, U.S. Econ Surge, Funk 49, and More.

title: High Prices, Empty Shelves
description: What is causing recent increases in food prices and supply chain disruptions, and how does this impact U.S. food security?

title: Russia's Gamble in Ukraine
description: Moscow has prepared a growing number of army, navy, and air force units for a possible invasion of Ukraine while also increasing irregular activities like cyber operations and subversion. If peace talks fail, escalation may include measures that are global in nature.

title: The Global Humanitarian Overview 2022: Climate, Gender, and Humanitarian Response
description: The climate crisis, Covid-19, and armed conflict put an estimated 274 million people in need of humanitarian assistance in 2022. The scope of needs necessitates a shift in aid architecture, including in gender equity and funding models.

title: Securing Global Standards for Innovation and Growth
description: To sustain the benefits of innovation, the United States should take steps to maintain a unified, global, and rules-based standards system. Securing the frameworks that establish standards is critical for accelerating innovation and promoting competition.

title: The Evening: Diplomatic Path, ISIS Defeated, Rock n Roll Never Forgets, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Diplomatic Path, ISIS Defeated, Rock n Roll Never Forgets, and More.

title: Will Russia Recognize the Self-Declared Separatist Republics in Eastern Ukraine?
description: Russian forces remain amassed along the Ukrainian border, and hopes of a diplomatic resolution to the crisis are in doubt. Could Moscow up the ante by recognizing the independence of Ukraine’s self-declared separatist republics?

title: Safeguarding the Global Market for Critical Minerals
description: Nikos Tsafos, James R. Schlesinger Chair for Energy and Geopolitics with the Energy Security and Climate Change Program, testifies before the Standing Committee on Industry and Technology of the Canadian Parliament.

title: Innovative Data Collection Methods for International Development
description: Innovative data collection technologies are transforming the way data is generated, collected, and analyzed. Data is helping monitor and address complex global sustainable development challenges such as financial crises, climate change, and pandemics.

title: Event Recap: "Inclusive Innovation: Building Opportunities for all Americans”
description: RAI Program Coordinator and Research Assistant, Gabrielle Athanasia, summarizes CSIS event "Inclusive Innovation: Building Opportunities for all Americans".

title: Afghanistan and the World: The National, Regional, and Global Impact
description: The Taliban takeover of Afghanistan will only leave a limited strategic impact on the reputation of the United States but still highlights the failures in the U.S. approach to face a major insurgency, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: Filling In the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework
description: CSIS experts Matthew P. Goodman and Bill Reinsch offer insight on how the Biden administration can fill in the gaps to craft a credible and durable Indo-Pacific economic framework (IPEF).
